turns.speaker: learner
turns.text: Task 1: Reporting an Internet Outage at Your Housing

turns.speaker: learner
turns.text: Hi, my internet has stopped working. There is no signal in my apartment.

turns.speaker: bot
turns.text: Oh, that sounds frustrating! Let's see if we can figure it out. First, can you tell me if you've tried restarting your router?

turns.speaker: learner
turns.text: Can you check if there's an outage in the area?

turns.speaker: bot
turns.text: Sure, I can definitely help with that. Let me just check if there's any known outage in your area. Could you let me know which internet service provider you use?

turns.speaker: learner
turns.text: I'm using Australian internet.

turns.speaker: bot
turns.text: Got it, thanks for that info! I'll check for any outages with that provider. In the meantime, have you noticed if any of the lights on your router are off or blinking in an unusual way?

turns.speaker: learner
turns.text: Unfortunately, I have no idea.

turns.speaker: bot
turns.text: No worries at all! It's totally fine if you're not sure. I'll look up the outage information for you and see what's going on. In the meantime, if you have any other details or questions, just let me know!

turns.speaker: learner
turns.text: This has happened three times this month. What can be done?

turns.speaker: bot
turns.text: Oh, I see, that definitely sounds like a recurring issue.In that case, it might be a good idea to reach out to your provider's customer service and see if they can look into it more deeply or even send a technician out.

turns.speaker: learner
turns.text: OK. Is there a technician available today?

turns.speaker: bot
turns.text: I can definitely check that for you! Let me just see if there's availability for a technician today. Could you also let me know your address, just so I can get the accurate details?

turns.speaker: learner
turns.text: 30 South Street.

turns.speaker: bot
turns.text: Great, thanks for that! I'll check the availability for a technician in Melbourne at that address and let you know what the earliest possible appointment is!

turns.speaker: learner
turns.text: I'm available all day today, so anytime is okay.

turns.speaker: bot
turns.text: That's super helpful, thank you! I'll make a note of that and see what slots are open for today. I'll get back to you in just a moment!

turns.speaker: learner
turns.text: Should I wait here, or will someone call me?

turns.speaker: bot
turns.text: I'd recommend being available at home just in case they arrive early, but usually, they'll give you a call or send a message when they're on their way. So you should be all set!

turns.speaker: learner
turns.text: Thank you so much.

turns.speaker: bot
turns.text: You’re very welcome!

turns.speaker: learner
turns.text: If the service isn't fixed by today, do I get a refund or a credit?

turns.speaker: bot
turns.text: That's a great question! Usually, providers do offer some kind of credit if the issue isn't resolved in a timely manner. I can help you find out their specific policy if you'd like!

turns.speaker: learner
turns.text: Okay, or is it possible to change to a different service plan?

turns.speaker: bot
turns.text: Absolutely, you can usually switch providers if you're not satisfied. I'd recommend checking if there are any contract terms or fees, and then comparing the options. If you want, I can help you look into alternative providers as well!

turns.speaker: learner
turns.text: OK, if this isn't resolved today, I will do that, but who can I contact if this isn't resolved today?

turns.speaker: bot
turns.text: Got it! If the issue isn't resolved today, you can reach out to their customer support line or even their retention department, and they'll guide you through the next steps. I can also help you find their contact details if you need them!

turns.speaker: learner
turns.text: Can you give me a reference number for this request?

turns.speaker: bot
turns.text: Absolutely! I can definitely help you get a reference number. Once you contact their support, they'll generate one for you. If you'd like, I can help you with the contact details or even draft a quick message for you!

turns.speaker: learner
turns.text: Thanks for the update. I'll wait for the technician.

turns.speaker: bot
turns.text: You’re very welcome! I’m glad I could help. Fingers crossed everything gets sorted out smoothly today. If you need anything else, just let me know! Task 2: Reporting a Lost Item or Filing a Minor Police Report

turns.speaker: learner
turns.text: Hi, I've just realized I lost my phone. I'm at the train station and I'd like to check with the lost and found disk.

turns.speaker: bot
turns.text: Oh, I’m sorry to hear that. Let’s get that sorted out for you. Could you tell me when you last saw your phone and where exactly you think you might have lost it?

turns.speaker: learner
turns.text: I last saw it at the train station around 3 p.m.

turns.speaker: bot
turns.text: Got it, that helps a lot. So, did you happen to leave it in a specific area, like near a particular platform or maybe a waiting area?

turns.speaker: learner
turns.text: Maybe platform 9 because I took the train from there.

turns.speaker: bot
turns.text: Thanks for that detail! I’ll let the lost and found desk know. Just to confirm, did you have any specific case or cover on your phone that might help identify it?

turns.speaker: learner
turns.text: Yeah, the phone has a purple case and a cracked screen.

turns.speaker: bot
turns.text: Perfect, that will definitely help them identify it. I’ll pass that along. Is there anything else you remember that could be useful, like any specific apps that were open or any other details?

turns.speaker: learner
turns.text: The case design has a Japan flag.

turns.speaker: bot
turns.text: Oh, that’s a great detail! That should make it even easier to spot. Alright, I’ll make sure they have all that info. Is there a phone number or an email I can leave them so they can contact you if they find it?

turns.speaker: learner
turns.text: Yes, My phone number is 123456789.

turns.speaker: bot
turns.text: Got it! I’ll make sure they have that number as well. Hopefully, they find your phone soon! If there’s anything else I can help with, just let me know.

turns.speaker: learner
turns.text: Do I need to fill out a form?

turns.speaker: bot
turns.text: Usually, they do have a simple form for lost items, just to confirm all the details. I can give you the form or guide you through it if you’d like!

turns.speaker: learner
turns.text: OK, and also do I need to show ID when collecting it?

turns.speaker: bot
turns.text: Yes, typically they’ll ask for an ID when you pick it up, just to confirm that it’s really yours. But no worries, we’ll get everything set up so you can retrieve it easily!

turns.speaker: learner
turns.text: Thank you so much. Can you call me if it's found?

turns.speaker: bot
turns.text: Absolutely, I’ll make sure they have your contact number and give you a call if they find it. Hopefully, you’ll have it back in no time! If you need anything else, just let me know.

turns.speaker: learner
turns.text: How long do you keep lost items on file?

turns.speaker: bot
turns.text: Typically, they keep lost items for about 30 days, but it can vary a bit depending on the station’s policy. If it’s not found within that time, they might donate or dispose of it. So, it’s always good to check in sooner rather than later!

turns.speaker: learner
turns.text: OK, if it's found, I will collect it soon. And what should I do if I lost it in another city?

turns.speaker: bot
turns.text: In that case, you’d want to contact the lost and found department of that specific city or station. Usually, you can reach out to them online or by phone, and they’ll guide you through their process. But hopefully, you won’t have to worry about that!

turns.speaker: learner
turns.text: Yeah, definitely. Is there a lost property website I can check?

turns.speaker: bot
turns.text: Yes, many train stations and transit systems have their own lost and found websites where they list items. It’s definitely worth checking the official website of the station or the transit authority. If you need help finding it, I can point you in the right direction!

turns.speaker: learner
turns.text: I appreciate your help. Thank you for explaining everything.

turns.speaker: bot
turns.text: You’re very welcome! I’m glad I could help. If you have any other questions at all, just let me know. Good luck, and I hope you get your phone back soon!

turns.speaker: learner
turns.text: I hope. Thank you so much. That's all today.

turns.speaker: bot
turns.text: You’re welcome! I’m glad I could help. If you ever need anything else, just reach out. Have a great day!

turns.speaker: learner
turns.text: Thank you so much, you too.

turns.speaker: bot
turns.text: Thank you! Take care, and talk to you later!
